Replies.Reply: They arrived almost half a century ago. Aliens, Scavs, whatever you want to call them. Their idea of how-do-you-do was to blow up our moon.
Without her moon, the earth went insane. Most were killed in the floods, as the cities came down, as everything caught fire. A year later their ground troops landed, to exterminate whoever was left.
They were probably surprised, what we were willing to do, to survive.
Humanity had to flee the Earth.
Yeah, I got 'em. You got 'em, Bob?
Oh, you know. Same ole' same.
You should come with me sometime.
What do you call this?
"I've got sunshine...
on a cloudy day. When it's cold outside I've got the month of May..."
"I guess you'd say... What can make me feel this way?"
Okay, Bob. Need you to work with me here.
"Talkin' 'bout my girl..."
Send it.
Absolutely not.
I see it, looks like full mid-
You know, I actually read about this game. Giants are literally on their own seven with 25 seconds on the clock...
Anyway... QB lets off this mile-
The thing just sails the length of the field.
And at the one yard line...
But the guy's too eager. He starts running it back.
Huh... The fuel-cell has been taken.
No... It's a master drone, too.
Bob, I'm going to need a cell.
So the guy keeps running. 30, 40, 50 yards and BAM! He gets pasted.
And wouldn't you know it, Giants recover, start running it back.
Bob, I said I needed...
Can you imagine it? 80,000 people on their feet. Everyone yelling "Go! Go! Go!..." Touchdown...
"Yahhhhhhhhhhhhhh... ."
Hey there, boy. Easy...
You got nothing to be scared of, buddy...
Ah, shi...
Call in number 166 for service up top. It's practically got its motherboard and half its hydraulics hanging out.
But it still wants to kill everybody...
I'll see you at the house later.
Well if you want anybody else, you're out of luck.
No...
That Master Drone was hit right over mid-town. Same area as the one we lost last night.
One day when we get to Mars, someone will want to know about this. From someone who was here.
Do we have to take it all?
Actually I've got a bit of a problem with a gyro here, call you when I've fixed it.
.There you are.
Vika, you're not going to believe...
.Jackpot.
That was my bike!!
Goodnight, folks... See you back here tomorrow. Same time, same channel...
No. I'm not supposed to bring them in the house.
You're right.
Ah-ha. So it's okay when I bring you something. But if I --
Was that really necessary?
It was just a plant, Victoria.
Hit me.
Look, they trained me to fix drones. That's my job, I get that. But it's not what I am. I can't simply do the same thing over and over again, every day, with that... world down there.
And if mission has a better Drone tech, they can get him to baby-
Pretty soon, there won't be anything left down there. No more plant life, no more water.
So forgive me if I want to enjoy it a little before the end.
Actually, it was like they were trying to... catch me.
Guess I look tasty.
Come on.
It's not so bad down here. They certainly don't have anything like this.
I'd have been overhauling the zero-
But then you realize, there are some things that were never supposed to happen in zero G.
It's awful. Just thinking about it, I get afraid...
Ocops.
Here, let me show you...
.Then what would you say in your report?
I can't get to a site fast enough unless I'm already out there. You know that.
One, Two, Three. Jack Harper.
What say we have a little fun today, Bob?
Just thinking I'd take Bob manual for the dust-off. Feeling the need.
Drone?
Don't be embarrassed, there's always a first time.
Send it over. I'll check it out.
All right, I'm coming up to the location.
New York, New York... It's a wonderful town. The Bronx is up, and the Battery's down...
Bob, give me audible on this signal.
It's an old radio system. It's been reactivated.
It's the Empire State --
Yeah, I may have seen another drone trap...
It's okay --
-- will cook me from the inside before I know it. Don't worry, I'm still more than five clicks from the beacons...
That's right, Bob. You know where we're going.
So, um... Victoria.
I was thinking, when our tour is up, maybe we'd stay. We could put in for another -- Wait, wait.
Maybe you should go, and I should stay...
I should stay...
Bob! Let's get going!
Vika? Vika, did you get that? An object hit near here. A ship.
I saw it through optics in the last minute. I'm not sure it was alien.
The Drones'll kill anything that moves.
Vika...
Negative. I'll report when I get to the site.
What are you looking at?
I'm here, and it's definitely one of ours.
I'm confirming it. I'm right here.
This thing is ancient, one of the old pre-war shuttles.
NO! 1!
NO! NO! They're firing on the ship. Vika, it's one of ours.
There are people here, and they're killing them!
Get out of here! Go away! Get!
Well, what the hell are you waiting for? GO ON!
It's you...
Open it!
The drones tried to kill her.
She came off a NASA shuttle. The drones were specifically targeting the pods --
Protocol? Protocol?! Who's the machinery now, Victoria?
I know it does. And when we report it, we'll also report that drones slaughtered the other human survivors from one of our ships.
You're safe. You're in a skytower, on Earth.
I know.
I know.
It's a Greek funeral vase. Which I want my ashes in, incidentally.
I just think we need to know why.
And what if I can't?
I read these books, of what it was like down here, before...
In this one book I was reading, a man describes being a child. He remembers a yellow kitchen, a baked apple.
What was so wonderful about life on the Tet?
When our time is up next month. I want to put in for one more tour.
It's almost all gone, Victoria. I want to be here for the end.
I don't know if it is or not, Victoria. I can't remember.
Do you remember her?
It's beautiful, isn't it? It's your home now.
How do you feel?
What was your shuttle's mission?
Your ship... it's pre-war.
No. No, of course not.
.There was a transmission. I don't know who sent it.
Funnily enough, you've found your man.
How did you know my name?
In a few hours, the Tet will come online. Victoria will report your rescue and I imagine they'll send someone down for you.
Yes.
.You could say that.
I'll bring her back before Tet-
She's the flight officer, she wants. to see the wreck of her ship and secure items there. You'd want to do the same thing.
Don't worry, we'll be back before you have to make your report.
I'll be fine.
I'll be home for breakfast.
The Scavs assumed taking out the moon would wipe us out, and it almost did. But we re-grouped, fought back. We beat them in the end.
That's if you call nuking half the planet beating anybody.
We harvest seawater to supply the Mars colony with the energy we need to live there. We're almost done. Pretty soon, there'll be no more water down here.
Yeah. What's left of us are up there now, ready to go where you were headed, Mars. 40 acres and a mule. What we've got left. What you've got.
We were born and raised up there.
Why are you looking at me like that?
Look, it doesn't matter --
We should stay close to...
What was it?
I'm sorry.
How do I know you...
Bob! HOME!
Who are you? Where is this?
We were taken by the Scavs...
The Scavs took everything from us.
Anyone would have...
When we get you up to the Tet, there's plenty -
Food.Foreveryone.
Look,it'samazing you've lasted thislong.But the radiation zonesare growing. All of this, willbe gone soon.
No one does. You go there ---
It took three decades to build the Tet. And when it was finally ready and it was time to go up, there were people who refused.
And so they stayed. And they were slaughtered.
I was born there!
No, my father was a --
I already told you --
What?
What?
No.
You're insane. This is insane.
There are people up there -
No! It will kill -
No. I won't do it.
You know I stare into weapons every day, so you can put that away. Because here's what I can tell you...
If the Rover found us, the Drones will too. Unless you want them to find you, let me get somewhere where I can send a signal.
The Drones would kill you. Let me try to stop that.
You're wasting time.
I can fix this.
I'll get to the antenna, send a signal with my location. The Tet will call off the search. .You should be safe, for now.
The Scavs brought it down ten years ago. All. this time, I thought we were at war with the Scavs... but it turns out we were just killing each other.
That old man is smart. Those fuel cells, the way he's got them tied in with your device... He could blow the whole station.
What do you want from me? I'm just a repairman.
This is bigger than me.
Look, stop, okay? Just --
STOP! You and that old man have this story... Except I know who I am, okay? I know who I am!
Why do I... what is it about this place?
When I sleep. You're always there.
Vika, it's me. I'm... all right.
Vika... the Scavs. They're humans, like us. The war has become some giant... mistake.
SHE'S --
Vika, she was my wife.
Then come with me.
Don't you see what it means?
Vika?
This is Technician Jack Harper.
She's dead.
Did you hear what I said? She's dead!
I want to talk to somebody.
DAMN YOU! I want to hear your voice!
We have to go.
Beech said to look in the radiation zones. I have to go there.
I've been wrong about everything else.
There...
You okay?
Radiation warning. We're five clicks from the border.
I got this.
Bob! BOB! What are you doing Bob!!!!!
Hold on!!
Son of a bitch, old man...
Stay here.
Hey! Hey, wait! Stop! Don't touch that Drone!
Julia! Stay back!
No!
STOP! You have to understand! You have to understand...
We're just Drones! We're just Drones, man! You and me! Don't you get it? Don't you know?
It's okay. It's going to be okay...
Julia...
I'll be back for you.
One, Two, Three. Jack Harper.
Okay... Let's go home.
.Just a bit of a dust up.
I cut myself, I just came by for...
No, I'll get it.
I'll get it. You stay here.
Good bye...
This is gonna pinch a little.
I always thought that plateau up there could be for a house someday. I thought about remaining here, letting the rest of humanity run off to Mars. And we'd just stay here.
No.
What was he like?
I'm not that man.
We can't stay here.
Stay here...
I'm the weapon of this war.
Why didn't you tell me?
The device...?
Julia...
Dream about us.
Bob, let's prep for outer atmosphere.
Finally. There you are.
I am delivering the survivor from the crash of the NASA ship.
We are... a more effective team.
Let's make history.
It's okay Bob, I'm scared too.
Entering at headway speed.
Understood.
You know, you made a mistake, Tet.
And right now, I want to see what you're made of...
Do you like books, Tet!? I like books. Can I tell you something that I read?
It's a story from Rome, a very great city, that you destroyed.
There was a guy named Horatius...
He said everybody dies. The thing is, to die well...
.What Horatius said, what his argument was, was this...
No.
How can a man die...
How can man die better Than facing fearful odds, For the ashes of his fathers, And the temples of his gods...
Do you hear me!!!
Good morning, Jack. I'll be your flight attendant for the day.
Today we will be running support on five Resource Gatherers working the seaboard. Coordinates coming to you... now. Please do confirm.
Drone perimeter defense is intact, although one went offline last night. How's the drop?
Alright, you're blind in five, four, three...
Two... one...
No, thank you. Have a nice ride.
Jack, you got some weather on your five, closing.
Okay, we've got another Drone downed last night.
Would you like to set a course to reserve fuel?
Yo no se. No data. It's not transmitting.
Tet coverage will go live in 11 minutes.
Please do not reminisce on my Comm, thank you very much.
Negative, technician. I have no eyes in the sky for another ten minutes. Do not land.
Jack I have no scope. The Tet is still offline.
What do you mean taken? Was it a malfunction?
Jack, you need to get out of there. Bring it home to the shop.
Jack, you know they can weaponize a fuel cell.
I'm reading the whole central core off alignment, you don't have the necessary tools.
Hold on, what did you just do?
Jesus, Jack. What the hell was that?
Jack, what happened?
You.
We only have two more months, Jack. Please try to resist the urge to do something stupid.
There's no other service signals.
There's no Drone signal there.
What are you doing, Jack?
It's not doing anyone any good here.
Jack, without a signal, you're looking for a needle in a haystack. I think we've had enough excitement for one day.
Mission, this is Lieutenant Victoria Kohl, requesting Drone intercept at coordinates sending now.
Check your seven.
You're not supposed to bring up surface items.
I tried to reach you earlier...
Then you can't just --
Where did you find this?
I know you think I'm a stickler for the rules, but you have no idea what sort of toxins could be in something like that.
I'm sorry, I don't think it's funny.
That's not the point. We have two more months and the last thing we need is you putting it all at risk.
You're hurt. What happened?
Come on.
This is gonna pinch a little...
Serves you right.
.I'm not saying you can't go into your caverns, I'm saying we have a job and if I'm trying to reach you and you're off on one of your adventures --
It's only a little while longer.
You act like there's not a war going on down there but there is and we can't leave even two of those things alive...
Dammit, Jack. They nearly killed you today.
Please be careful. If they get to you, what happens to me?
Answer the question.
Jack.
Can you imagine when we go back up? Having a face to face conversation again? I can't believe it's finally ending.
We made it.
I wonder what duty I would have pulled. Probably programming the Mars boats.
Stop!
I've been happy here. With you.
I can't remember zero gravity.
I should have seen that coming.
Don't go out today until we get a signal.
A hundred terraformed acres on Mars is all you have to think about.
I love you.
STATUS: "LOG RECEIVED."
You're welcome...
Jack... I've got a rogue signal.
No... It's.. I'm not sure what it is.
On its way. Be careful, okay?
Jack, you're right on top of it.
What did you find?
Define reactivated.
Jack, that signal's going out over the whole territory. You need to blow the structure.
It's ancient history, Jack. You know the procedure. Blow it.
Check your course, you're headed right at the border.
You're at the edge of range, Jack.
No, it's not okay. You get in too close that radiation --
What are -- you ---- out there Jack?
Jack...?
Jack? Jack, I really need you online...
Mission, this is Lieutenant Victoria Kohl, requesting a link.
I have a rogue signal of unknown origin. I'm sending you a relay.
Technician is... experiencing technical difficulties...
Yes, we're an effective team.
We're happy, to be coming home.
Will communicate findings on next Tet cycle. Understood.
Where the hell have you been?
It's an external. An alien ship.
Turn around, Jack. The Drones will handle the situation.
Just for once wait for your orders on this one, Jack. This is serious.
Technician. This is your Control.
You heard me.
I'm not confirming this from the Tet.
Well it didn't recognize her.
I don't know what the machinery did or didn't do. There's protocol...
Go get the cutter, and a breather, and my big bag. Now. The Pod's been damaged, she's not doing well, let's get her out of there.
.This has to be reported.
Right there, be careful...
Lift her up, we have to get some air into her.
No. Don't. Let her get the fluid out.
We need to get her cleaned up.
We have to get her up to the Tet.
I don't have the facilities here.
What's going on?
Here. Drink this. You're dehydrated... You've been in a very bad crash. Your ship came down.
What's your name?
You need to rest quietly. You've been in delta sleep for a long time.
Best guess? About 65 years.
Shhhhhh...
Tomorrow, I'll report that we have her.
Jack...
What do you want from me, Jack?
Jack, please. This isn't why we're here. This is just what we have to do before our real lives begin. We've given them five years and now we get to go home.
So just leave this alone. It's not our job.
I know. That was the world before. Your little obsession...
Please. Please. Don't you understand? We have a chance to be on the first boats out, to be the first to settle Mars, raise a family. Five years. Proof that we are an effective team.
Everything we've wanted is waiting for us up there. Please, Jack.
Jack! What are you doing?
She shouldn't be --
Jack, please.
That's not it. I can't protect you with the Tet offline and I just have a very bad...
Jack... This isn't just about protocol. I'm trying to understand.
Jack! Jack! There's something coming your way. JACK!!"
JACK! JACK...!
He's disappeared.
My Technical Officer, Jack Harper.
.Six hours.
The Scavs took him. I witnessed it. He has a...
There's a woman with him. The survivor of the crashed shuttle, Julia Sommerville.
I told you, she's with the Technical Officer. I'm requesting permission to re-task the Drones for search and rescue.
Yes, I mean. I don't know.
Go to hell.
No.
I saw you. I saw you two.
Stay away from me with the truth!
You never really loved me, did you, Jack?
I told them. The drones will be here. For her. For you.
Oh, Jack. I think they made us.
She checks her map. Jack's Bubbleship is headed straight at a large red swath of territory marked out, toxic radiation levels constantly monitored.
SVUNK! SVUNK! Behind Jack, plasma rounds impact the Pod with the man in it, the metal going nova, collapsing...
.Jack.
What about the others? How did you get out?
.Julia. Julia.
How long...?
Where's Jack...?
A bit more... located.
I don't remember. I should get back to the ship. I might be able to find the flight recorder.
Have you ever seen a ship like that?
I wonder what brought us back?
We'll never really know without the flight recorder.
She says we can't go down there, that it's too dangerous.
What?
Have I?
.You look like someone I once knew.
I understand I owe you my life.
What happens now?
You fly that thing?
Alright then. Don't you want to know?
Thank you. I feel very well.
So I guess I'm around... a hundred years old.
What happened next?
A dry planet...
What about you?
Sorry.
It's so beautiful.
No! NO! It's been taken. DAMN  IT!
It matters, okay!? You don't...
You're staring at me.
It reminds me of home...
Jack, what he said about the Tet...
The bomb...
You brought down the Odyssey. You sonofabitch you crashed our ship.
The Tet... is an alien ship, Jack.
It was you, Jack.
You and Victoria. We were all on the Odyssey. We were supposed to make contact...
NO!!
What happened...?
What will you do now?
Jack, you can't turn them in.
You and I started the same year at  NASA.
It wasn't really about space for me, it was about... what could be out there. Life...
But for you, it was always the stars. You wanted to fly further and faster than any one else.
I'm talking about a man I knew, who was fearless. A man who wouldn't bow out of a fight, ever.
That's right... What do you remember?
Ten days before we got our go-
Don't you remember what happened here?
There are a few pages missing, but it's the same book.
Where are we going?
And if he's just a crazy old man?
No.
What is that?
Jack...
Don't touch me. Don't She lurches away from him, body running on fear and adrenaline. Jack nods, accepting her terror of him.
Okay...
I'm sorry. Jack...
He loved this song.
He was arrogant, and annoying, and the best man I'd ever known.
.And I loved him.
Shhhhh. Yes you are.
It wants me. Bring me to it.
I'm right. You know I am. It's the only way.
Is it ready?
Let's just do it.
Jack... Jack!!
.I got this.
Jack...
Jack?
The Tet arrived almost half a century ago. And it changed our world forever...
It was probably surprised, what we were willing to do, to survive.
We had to unlearn what it meant, to call something our home.
But we did. We started over. And so here we are now, everyone that's left...
Well, almost everyone.
It's your father. Come on, let's go pick him up.
She turns and grabs him, desperate.
idea how long I've waited, for this?
Well, let me tell you, Jack. It's been a long time...
We're deep underground. Very deep underground.
Oh... The "Scavs".
Tell me, Jack. Have you ever met a Scav, up close?
No, of course not. You just repair the damage, keep the Drones up and killing. Don't ask many questions, do you, Jack? No part of the...
.job description.
Brutal, if you think about it.
Interesting, Jack. Interesting.
Lllllllights!
You see...? We're not Aliens, Jack. We're very much human.
Of course that's a problem. Your drones go for human shapes, human voices. So... we change our shapes, change our voices.
The Drones still kill us, but they're not nearly so aggressive as when they smell a human target.
To what, Jack?
You saw it yourself. You almost got yourself blown to bits protecting her. I've been meaning to ask you, why did you do that?
Anyone. Would have. Interesting.
Very interesting.
Careful, Jack. I'm afraid you're not very popular here.
Welcome back to earth, commander.
We grow what we can, under the lights. It isn't much; Wheat-
There is? Plenty. Plenty of what?
The zones... the area you don't patrol...
-- Your organs boil from the inside. I've heard.
I know what I did. But tell us, Commander, why did you have a bomb on board, what was it for? Tell him.
It attacked us. First it destroyed our moon. Then it unleashed its primary weapon, a brilliant weapon...
I was born in Chicago, Jack. I used to go to baseball games with my father. I used to get two big hot dogs, fill 'em up with relish, and mustard. Just go to town. Me and my pops, watching the sox.
You have any memories like that Jack?
Was what? Tall? Fat? He yell at your mom? Ever go to a baseball game, Jack?
Right, sorry. Tell me how your mother smelled.
My mother, smelled like warm fruit. Like oranges, sitting in the sun.
If you had looked more carefully at the wreckage of the odyssey, you would have noticed there were two empty sleep pods. The Pilot, and the Co-pilot...
The Tet is an alien vessel, Commander Jack Harper. It came and destroyed our moon and most of humanity when it did. And ever since, with your help, it's been trying to finish the job.
I'm sorry, Jack. It's not good news, I know. You've been turned to the wrong side.
But now, with your help, we can finally destroy it.
What? People like you? We are the last real people.
Pockets like this one, hiding out, dying. Probably all over the planet.
We didn't win the war, Jack. We lost.
It has taken us ten years to get here, but we finally have a weapon, and a working Drone to carry it. Except we can't successfully program the Drone.
Well well, we may be out of time.
It will kill that ugly stain on the sky. That's all! Now program the Drone!
What's your plan, Jack? Tell the Tet where we are, so they can send a nice big welcome --
Well, you're the repairman.
Jack... What if I told you that I had been to your radiation zones.
She does.
The first ones were soldiers, programmed only to kill.
Later, there were new versions.
The Tet. The clockmaker God.
Not the kind of news that.
.motivates a man.
We lost, Jack. It won.
No Drone. It will go on, devouring world, after world...
You like books, Jack.
"Cowards die many times before their deaths; The valient never taste of death but once."
It followed him here. I told you this was a mistake!
He won't help us. We bury them both, make our run as soon as we can load up.
You can't trust him!
What makes you think he's any different from the others?
He turns, starts to lean on the old telescope, draws back, staring at the thing like it bit him.
There, right there. Take a look.
The tall billboard, with the girl on it.
Now, pan to the right, slowly...
Julia...
We should just tell everybody.
Oh, okay. I don't understand.
No, when we come home...
Hey...
It pulls out of an arc, ACCELERATES, closing on the Bubbleship as the Bubbleship tears away into a cloud bank, goes in. Drone 166 follows, seconds behind.
You're early...
What happened out there? I lost contact.
Are you all right?
.What?
You dreamed a lot last night. I was thinking, you have to start writing them down.
I'll get it.
We should watch a movie tonight.
I was going over the catalog and there's still a bunch of your favorites I haven't seen...
Hey, you didn't say goodbye.
So far, from this distance, we're still reading zero heat signatures, no sign of organic life. Did I mention we're still really far away?
I think she just made my point --
Which is why we need to make contact, before it just blows on by like some...
This is a once in a lifetime opportunity.
We are. We're going to let it proceed whereever it's going...
I'll be right back...
Mission plan has us approaching to one hundred kilometers, doing our initial readouts...
Stop. We don't know what it is, if it has intentions.
It could be inert. Anything on it could be long gone by now.
Which is why we need to make contact.
I agree with Commander Harper. It crossed whatever light years of space and time to come this close to us. We're not going to really know anything about it from this far away.
Mission control says maintain one thousand meters.
What are you doing?
We have our orders, Jack. We're to let it proceed without --
Jack...
falls inert in front of Julia as the Tet Explodes in the sky above her. She stares up, tears already running down her face.
Who is that?
